definitions.body: :1Sa 14:40 region across or beyond, side (on format. cf. Ba:NB 144; cf. esp. As. êbru, êbirtu, id., êbirtan, adv. beyond);—´[[י]] abs. 1Sa 14:4 +; cstr. Jos 24:4 +; sf. [[עֶבְרוֹ]] Is 47:15; pl. cstr. [[עֶבְרֵי]] Is 7:20, Je 48:28 (si vera l., v. infr.); sf. [[עֲבָרָיו]] 1Ki 5:4, Je 49:32 (read probably [[עֶבְרֵיהֶם]], so Vrss), [[עֶבְרֵיהֶם]] Ex 32:15; —

region across or beyond anything (usu. wady, river, or sea), mostly c. prep.: [[בר אַרְנוֹן]]:[[בְּעֵ]] Nu 21:13 (JE) Ju Jdg 11:18, cf. Je 25:22; [[הַיׇּם]] ´[[אֶל־ע]] De 30:13 b, [[מַעֵבֶר לַיׇּם]] v:De 30:13 a beyond the sea; [[לְנַהֲרֵי־כוּשׁ]] ´[[מֵע]] Is 18:1, cf. ´[[עַד־מֵע]] 1Ki 4:12 ([[מִן]] on the side of, on, v. [[מִן]]

definitions.title: 1 c
definitions.body: ; so usu. c. ´[[ע]]); but also (rarely) ´[[מֵע]] from the other side of Zep 3:10, Job 1:19, 2Ch 20:2; abs. ´[[הַע]] 1Sa 26:13 to the other side (sc. of a ravine; after [[וַיַּעֲבׂר]]); [[בְּעֵבֶר הָעֵמֶק]] 1Sa 31:7, read perh. ´[[בְּעָרֵי הָע]], so Klo Bu HPS; [[בְּעֶבְרֵי פִי־פָָחַת]] Je 48:28 beyond the mouth of a chasm is dub.; Gie prop. [[בְּחׂרֵי כֵפֵי בַתּׂת]] in the rock-holes of the precipices; esp. (chiefly Hex, 37 t.) [[הַיַּרְדֵּן]] ´[[ע]] (30 t.), or (less oft., Jos 13:32 + 13 t.), [[לַיַּרְדֵּן]], [[לְיַרְדֵּן יְרֵחוֹ]] (only c. ´[[מֵע]]), of either E. Jordan (36 t.) or W. Jordan land (9 t.) acc. to standpoint of speaker or writer:

definitions.title: A.
definitions.body: E. Jordan (fr. standpoint of writer) Ge 50:10, Ge 50:11 (J) Jos 17:5 (JE) De 1:1, De 1:5, De 4:41, De 4:46, De 4:47, De 4:49, Jos 1:14, Jos 12:1, Jos 13:8 (D), Nu 22:1, Nu 32:19, Nu 34:15, Jos 13:27, Jos 13:32, Jos 14:3, Jos 20:8 (P), Ju Jdg 7:25, Jdg 10:8, 1Sa 31:7, Is 8:23, 1Ch 6:63, 1Ch 12:37; fr. standpoint of speaker, Jos 7:7 (JE), Jos 24:8 (E), Jos 1:15, Jos 2:10, Jos 9:10, Jos 18:7, Jos 22:4 (D), Ju Jdg 5:17; in Nu 35:14 (Moses speaks) it is land opp. to Can., cf. Nu 32:32; in De 3:8 (Moses speaks) writer (D) ascribes his own standpoint to Moses; (oft. further topogr. note is added, e.g. [[מִזְרָ֫חָה]] De 4:49 +, [[מִזְרַח הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ]] Jos 1:15 +, etc.); ´[[אֶל־עֵבֶר בְּנֵי יִשְׂר]] Jos 22:11 toward the region opposite the sons of Israel appar. also refers to E. side (v. Steuernagel on text).

definitions.title: B.
definitions.body: W. Jordan (9 t.), from standpoint of speaker De 3:20, De 3:25 (Moses), also De 11:30 (but here + [[מְכוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ]], and in all foll. some special designation of West), + [[יׇ֫מָּה]] Jos 5:1 (D; from standpoint of those just crossed), Jos 12:7 (opposite East v:Jos 12:1-6), Jos 22:7 (id.; Kt [[מעבר]], Qr [[בְּעֵבֶר]]), cf. Jos 9:1 (as Jos 5:1); + [[וׇהָָלְאָה]] Nu 32:19 a (opposite East v:b); in 1Ch 26:30 [[מַעֲרָָבָה]] ´[[לַיַּר]] ´[[מֵע]] ´[[ע]] seems = side (v. infr.). Also [[הַנׇּהָר]] ´[[בְּע]] beyond the river (Euphrates) Jos 24:2, Jos 24:14, Jos 24:15 (E; Kt Qr ´[[מֵע]]), ´[[מֵע]] 2Sa 10:16 = 1Ch 19:16 beyond, and 1Ki 14:5 to the other side of (v. [[מִן]]

definitions.title: 1 c
definitions.body: ); ´[[מֵע]] from beyond the river only Jos 24:3 (E), in all these = beyond the Euphr. eastward, from standpoint of those west of Euphr.; so pl. ´[[בְּעֶבְרֵי הַנּ]] Is 7:20; poss. also ´[[ע]] alone (si vera l.) in the difficult passage Nu 24:24; [[הַנׇּהָר]] ´[[ע]] = region beyond the river (Euphr.) westward (from standpoint of those in Babylonia or Persia) Ne 2:7, Ne 2:9, Ne 3:7, Ezr 8:36; also 1Ki 5:4, 1Ki 5:4 (written in Bab.; cf. BAram. [[עֲבַר]], and Dr:Intr (6) 504).

(Opposite) side, side: [[הַלָּז]] ´[[מֵע]] 1Sa 14:1 on yonder side seems transition to this meaning; [[מִזֶּה]] ´[[מֵהָע]] twice, v:1Sa 14:4 = on one side, on the other side, so [[אֶחָד]] ´[[לְע]] twice v:1Sa 14:40; even [[מִשְּׁנֵי עִבְרֵיהֶם]] Ex 32:15 (E) on their two sides (i.e. of tablets); [[הָאֵפוֹד בָָּיְתָה]] ´[[אֶל־ע]] Ex 28:26 (P) toward the inner side of the ephod; in 1Ki 7:20, 1Ki 7:30 ´[[ע]] appar. = at the side of or opposite, but the archit. details are obscure; [[מִכָּל־עֲבָרָיו מִסָּבִיב]] 1Ki 5:4 on all sides of him, round about, [[מִכָּל־עֲבָרָיו]] Je 49:32 (rd. [[עֶבְרֵיהֶם]] Vrss Gie) from all sides of them (all directions, = [[מִכָּל־סְבִיבָָיִךְ]] v:Je 49:5); [[אֶל־עֵבֶר פָּנׇיו יֵלֵָכוּ]] to the side of their faces (i.e. in front, straight forward) they (always) went Ez Eze 1:9, Eze 1:12, Eze 10:22, cf. [[פָּנֶיהָ]] ´[[עַל־ע]] Ex 25:37 to give light upon the space in front of it; [[אִישׁ לְעֶבְרוֹ תָּעוּ]] Is 47:15 they wander away each in his own direction (regardless of thee).—On 1Ch 26:30 v. supr.
